cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 60 miles south of Camaguey, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking west-northwest across Cuba, expected to enter the southeastern Gulf of Mexico tonight, then turn northwest toward the upper Texas–south-central Louisiana coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the Texas–Louisiana border (around Cameron LA)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical-storm watch presently limited to the Florida Keys – no Gulf Coast watches yet
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical-storm warnings confined to Cuba, Cayman Islands and Dry Tortugas – none along U.S. Gulf Coast yet
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Upper Texas coast eastward across all of Louisiana and into Mississippi/Alabama according to the 5-day cone
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (sustained 40-60 mph, higher gusts) possible late Wednesday into early Thursday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential 3–5 ft surge along the upper Texas coast and within Galveston Bay if Laura tracks just east of Houston
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of heavy rain bands could deliver 4–8 inches, locally higher, Wednesday night through Thursday
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in outer rain bands, minor coastal flooding and rough seas that will disrupt vessel traffic and cargo operations
